title: Citi Foundation-supported PBS series continues, focusing on peer-to-peer assistance
summary: The second installment of a special financial inclusion series underwritten by the Citi Foundation will debut this evening on the PBS weekly public affairs news program "Need to Know". The five-part series, "Your Money and Your Life," illustrates the Citi Foundation's commitment to educate, empower and transform low-income communities by supporting efforts to build financial capability among consumers. Click here to read a previous post about the series' debut.

The five-part series, "Your Money and Your Life," illustrates the Citi Foundation's commitment to educate, empower and transform low-income communities by supporting efforts to build financial capability among consumers. tag-3: Tonight's segment will examine peer-to-peer assistance as a new model for helping lower income Americans move closer to financial stability. Need to Know will travel to Oakland, California to report on the Family Independence Initiative, cited by the White House as a model program in which families meet monthly to set goals, advise each other, and track changes in income, assets, debts, health and education. The program gives families $30 for every goal achieved, up to $200 a month, and matches some of their savings. Among the first 86 families in the program, after two years, earnings were up 23% and savings 240%, 33% expanded a business or opened one, 17% bought new homes, people got promotions and raises, and a quarter of the families that had been receiving government income or housing subsidies dropped them.
tag-4: The Citi Foundation is focused on identifying and supporting innovative approaches to the most challenging issues around efforts to expand financial inclusion. Tonight's episode of "Your Money and Your Life" spotlights a trailblazing concept that is having a positive impact on one community.
tag-5: "Need to Know" airs Fridays at 8:30 PM EDT. Check local listings for exact air times nationally. View episodes of Your Money and Your Life later tonight at www.pbs.org/wnet/need-to-know/
